The taco servings are relatively small so you will need a few to fill you up but don't worry they are pretty reasonably priced. I had the soft taco special with slow cooked lamb. It was great although slightly bland until doused a bit in chile sauce. Nearby Crazy Homies has more atmosphere but for non nonsense Mexican at cheap prices this is the place to go.

ViVNe7RfK0xoc6cjJSCSww.text: It's damn hard to find decent Mexican food in London and this place comes as close to it as possible.  Good for lunch.  Margaritas are delicious.  They also sell spices and products.

1NQA57WGwbjNAOJOTCKjvA.text: As good as it gets for the UK. The best Mexican I've had on this side of the pond. Fresh, warm tortillas. Spicy meat. Great guacamole. Delicious marinades. Just go! It's great! And try the Horchata-- cinnamon rice milk drink. Yummy!

DFR62tb5A7JnITUFa-H9ig.text: A Mexican friend of mine told me she used to feel homesick in London, until she discovered Taqueria on Westbourne Grove. I've travelled extensively in Mexico too, and I can confirm that the food here is real Mexican food, not the Tex-Mex that passes for Mexican in other restaurants. I recommend at least two plates of tacos per person if you have a good appetite. The best thing is to go with a group of friends so you can order many different dishes and try them all. The only thing I would say is that it can get a bit busy (and noisy) in the evenings, so if you want a quiet meal, come here at lunchtime instead.

HSLIq6pRreMLevm1aJbg9A.text: Went here with my girlfirend. Not a good experience. Service was chaotic. Customers seemed so frustrated with lack of table clearing that they started to load their empty plates on to an adjacent table. Much to my surprise this was ignored by the staff who let the dirty plates continue pile up. Worse still, food was tasteless, VERY small portions and much overpriced. When pointing this out to the manager, she more or less said Too Bad. To be avoided.

_wYZttbFbIwGSYe7sDD4OA.text: Taqueria is a perfectly decent Mexican place in Baywater/Westbourne Grove. Attached to it, it is worth noting, is a deli with a good assortment of chilies to buy, and I certainly grabbed a few on my way out! Taqueria, like most if not all Mexicans in London, will not satisfy those of you (like me) who have a bit of American in them and are out seeking that TexMex style hard shell taco, but if you like the tacos at Wahaca, then this place is for you. To sum it up, indeed, it's like Wahaca but has just the taco part of the menu, and a much more extensive one at that. And the decoration and atmosphere are much more like a small deli than Wahaca's bustle. It serves good softshell tacos, made with quality ingredients, and each table has a bottle of hot sauce to help you spice it up to your personal taste nirvana. Still, I had 3 tacos and it came to 25 pounds so it's hardly the cheapest place to hit if you are truly hungry.

Iab6I7u2l3C8n5qvnHsfqw.text: Gringos who love Mexican food split into two factions: those who love the small el DF-style corn tortillas and those who love the large, flour tortillas of Tex-Mex. I belong to the former camp, and the only place in London that comes close to satisfying my cravings for soft corn tacos filled with prawns, fish, bistec, carne asada, carnitas, you name it, is Taqueria in Notting Hill. The corn meal is a different variety from the kind you find in Mexico, and the tacos al pastor don't match the savoury sweet-tart kick of El Tizoncito in Mexico City, but this place (along with the El Azteca Mexican food store in Elephant & Castle, which delivers!) has some of the best, freshest tortillas in London. Taqueria offers a good range of seafood/meat tacos with a good balance of chopped onions and cilantro. If you are feeling desperate for real flavour after having tried the mildy spicy ready meals at Tesco and Sainsbury, go to Taqueria; squeeze some lime; and pour on the hot sauce. I also recommend getting the flor de jamaica or watermelon juice with your tacos. There is a fair selection of non-taco dishes as well, but if you want moles or other more complex dishes, my Mexican friends prefer Mestizo. The bill at Taqueria will run between £25 to £35 per person, including a couple of drinks.

OlhFZyYc57_jq4EQJik9xA.text: I love this place, am not a fan of TexMex and found Taqueria Ltd to be proper Mexican food. Margaritas are superb! Try haveing a soup as a starter then a couple of tacos and you will be full. Not keen on the side salad as it is just iceberg lettuce with a few cucmbers, go for the corn which has melted cheese on it....delicious. Can't wait to go back.
